_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Chemical and Allied Products Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText: The Chem Quip, Fresno facility stores and distributes swimming pool equipment and supplies along with water treating chemicals for all associated industries. The facility is located at 4753 E. Commerce Ave in Fresno CA, 93725. The surrounding area is industrial and is sparsely populated. The facility has an Emergency Response Plan to insure that all regulated substances are stored and transported in accordance with all applicable laws and regulations.                                                    Through the Emergency Response Plan, Chem Quip Fresno has assessed the potential affects of an accidental release of a hazardous substance. This assessment includes a worst case scenario and one alternative scenario.                                      The Chem Quip Fresno facility has established a prevention program to prevent the accidental release of a regulated substance. This program includes safety precautions, maintenance, inspections, and employee training                                                    A response program has also been established that requires specific actions to be taken in the event of an emergency. These actions include procedures for notifying public and local agencies responsible for responding to accidental releases, information on emergency health care, and employee response training measures.                                                                                     DISCRIPTION OF FACILITY AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE(S) HANDELED                                                                           The Chem Quip Fresno facility handles one regulated substance in its distribution operation. The substance is Chlorine, which is used for water disenfection. The Chlorine is stored in 150-pound cylinders in a sprinkled warehouse at 4753 E. Commerce Ave. As many as 80 cylinders may be in storage at one time                                                                                                          GERNRAL ACCIDENTAL

RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS                    Specific prevention steps that Chem Quip Fresno has taken include CSTI Certified Training for Emergency Responders. Currently there is one CSTI Certified Incident Commander and one CSTI Certified Technician Level Responder on site. There is one Chlorine Cylinder Recovery Vessel (coffin) on site for DOT approved transport and containment of any cylinder suspected of having a leak. SCBA as well as level "B" chemical resistant suits are also maintained on site. Inspections are performed daily, inventories are analyzed so that the lowest inventories of hazardous substances are maintained, and stock is rotated on a "first in - first out                                         basis"                                                                                                                                                                                  FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY                                                                                                                                                                              This facility has had no accidents in the last five years. This facility has had no accidents in over 25 years.                                                                                                                                                                                EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM                                                                                                                             The Fresno facility of Chem Quip, Inc has trained personnel to respond to an emergency chlorine gas release and take the necessary steps to stop or contain the release. The facility has coordinated with the Fresno and Clovis Fire Departments and has trained with both agencies on numerous occasions.                                                                                                PLANNED CHANGES T

O IMPROVE SAFETY                                                                                                                      The Chem Quip Fresno facility plans to focus on training in the future to become fully Emergency Response self sufficient. Training is planned when candidates are selected to man the response team. Actual release scenarios will then be practiced with the training demo cylinder and other safety equipment maintained on site.
